title: Fragment of a public Latin inscription
support: Fragment of white marble slab, broken on all sides; finished on the reverse

layout.p: Parts of two lines of latin letters are preserved. Substantial vacat below line 2.

handNote.lettering:
The letters are neatly V-cut, of wide proportions, with minimal serifs. P is open; S
                                    has a larger upper half, leaning slightly to the right. Words are separated by a
                                    comma-like three pointed serif.

provenanceFound._: Excavated 9 September 1970, near entrance to room 2 of west portico of the agora.

repository._: Antiquarium e sito archeologico di Halaesa

museum.name: Antiquarium e sito archeologico di Halaesa
museum.description: Excellent display of material from the site, including lovely sculpture and a superb epigraphic collection

location.address: Contrada santa maria delle palate, 98079 - Tusa (ME)
